caption:
The photograph depicts a scene from an urban setting, featuring a multilevel car parking facility in the foreground. Stacked on large, metal, yellow storage racks are various cars, displaying an assortment from different eras but mainly dating from the mid-to-late 20th century. The vehicles range in color and model, with one prominently featuring a logo "GM" on its side, suggesting it is manufactured by General Motors.

In the background, a series of old, weathered apartment buildings with multiple windows are visible. The architecture shows signs of aging and urban wear. In front of these buildings, a multi-lane road can be seen, though the traffic is light with only a few cars visible.

The setting appears to be under an overcast sky, giving the colors a muted, cold feel which enhances the industrial and somewhat gritty aesthetic of the scene. The area is devoid of visible greenery, emphasizing the urban environment. The photograph has a historic feel, reflecting a time when environmental and spatial challenges in growing metropolitan areas were addressed with pragmatic, industrial solutions like vertical car storage.
title: The Bronx in Manhattan, New York. Transportation in an urban and industrial area like New York produces environmental problems of its own. Freeways sprawl across the landscape and cut through cities, isolating one neighborhood from another. The auto must take responsibility for air pollution, one of the more critical problems of the environment which affect the bight.
